feedback.explanation: With sorting the task is significantly easier to complete, however, it wasn't obvious that I could sort. Try changing the mouse cursor at least. Selecting the node wasn't easy either, I clicked on the bar and it didn't select it

task1.prompt: Select the European account which has liked the most tweets.

feedback.explanation: The bars rendered outside of my screen width, so I had to reduce the size of the whole page (cmd -). Finding connections on a matrix is always difficult, but the hightlighting really helped. Sorting was very useful once more, but I had to click about 4 times to get it to work, seems like it only work when I clicked on the text of "Type". I had to perform a sequential scan, and comparing the bars was very difficult, I basically used the tooltips

task2.prompt: Select all of Lane's neighbors that are *people* and have more friends than followers.

feedback.explanation: I really have to push my understanding of network matrices to figure out this one. Sorting really helped (the chart was sorted by type by default, which seems a little unfair). Highlighting was also very useful, but I had to remember many things at once

task3.prompt: Select the *institution* from North America that has retweeted Jeffrey and mentioned Robert.

feedback.explanation: Being able to sort by # of tweets really helped here, however I had to manually count the number of purple boxes. Opacity was very difficult to tell apart here. I kept on wishing to be able to sort by number of rts too. I also had to check the legend about 6 times to learn which one was rts and which one was mentions

task4.prompt: Which person is frequently retweeted in this network despite being relatively inactive on twitter?
